text: Mezobromelia fulgens is a species of plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is endemic to Ecuador. It grows in the páramo and high-elevation forest of the Andes. It is terrestrial or grows as an epiphyte.Manzanares, J.M. & Pitman, N. 2003. Mezobromelia fulgens. The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species 2003. Downloaded on 09 September 2015. There are five known subpopulations of this bromeliad. It is threatened by loss of habitat to agriculture. ==References== fulgens Category:Endangered plants Category:Endemic flora of Ecuador Category:Páramo flora Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
